abstract: Bloomberg administration’s contest to create a school of applied sciences on Roosevelt Island has set high environmental standards, but some universities competing for rights have gone even further in their proposals; features include geothermal wells, energy-neutral buildings and a filtration marsh; Stanford and Cornell are so far seen as frontrunners.
snippet: Universities’ competing proposals to build a science graduate school on Roosevelt Island include features like geothermal wells, energy-neutral buildings and a filtration marsh.
lead_paragraph: Universities’ competing proposals to build a science graduate school on Roosevelt Island include features like geothermal wells, energy-neutral buildings and a filtration marsh.
